text:
e="preserve">Ronald Louis Schwary (May 23, 1944 – July 2, 2020) was an American producer and director. He was known for producing "Ordinary People" (for which he won an Academy Award for Best Picture), "Sabrina", "Havana" and "Random Hearts". He was born in The Dalles, Oregon.
Schwary died July 2, 2020 in Hollywood, California from multiple system atrophy at the age of 76.
